result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth Gomez Cruz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kenneth Gomez Cruz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kenneth Gomez Cruz was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:59 AM Defendant Kenneth Gomez Cruz in court, in custody.  Attorney Dominic Richards in court for Kenneth Gomez Cruz.  Prosecuting attorney Hector Al-Homsi in court for the State of Wisconsin. Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

AMENDMENTS: 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count # 2  . 
Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT # 1
The Court sentences Defendant to:
-Serve 10 days in Dane County Jail, WITHOUT Huber; cs to 21CM189

-Days credit to jail: 1

COURT COSTS:
Ct #1
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved

-DNA on file

-Defendant advised of post-conviction rights

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

09:29 AM Defendant appeared.  Colleen Lennon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
